title: On the Wrightsville Beach side of Masonboro Inlet the rock wall does not start for a few hundred feet. There is a wood/metal bulkhead that spans the gap between the beach and rocks. What is the design purpose of that? On the Masonboro Island side the rock wall is solid from the sound all the way out to the inlet entrance out in the ocean.
text:
We got an answer after all.

Here's a link to the answer to your question.

http://www.myreporter.com/?p=15769
